value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MJVSu47iMmo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8ASw-J0PuN8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Take Power BI data alerts to the next level with Microsoft Flow
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how easy it is to use Microsoft Flow to take Power BI data alerts to the next level. Use Microsoft Flow to send to additional people.  Guy in a Cube Courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Understanding the basics of Power BI Premium

value.title: Using the Key Influencer visual in Power BI Desktop

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/SlQJaryCLy4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Variable TOP N Filter)
value.excerpt: Let me show you how you can create a TOP N Report in Power BI, with a Variable N, so that you can show the Numbers and the Detail for Top 10, Top 50 or Top 100 Customers, Products or really anything else. And still have it fully interactive, so you can slice and dice it as you like. 👉 Download Power
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/wKfPS1yZfE0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Set Up Power BI Gateway to Connect to On Premise Data in Personal Mode
value.excerpt: Power BI Gateway acts as a bridge to let PowerBI.com (Cloud) connect to your On-Premise (Local) Data Sources – like local Excel Files or a local SQL Server. Watch our complete video series on Power BI Gateways: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7GQQXV5Z8edw57_eLqD9By5mzxIqxSJ1 1. What is a Power

value.title: Power BI Apps and App Workspaces: How to distribute Power BI content to a Large Audience
value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups. Then any user (within the Group you provided Access to) can click "Get Apps" to consume your App - which comprises the Dashboards,

value.title: Combine Multiple or All Sheets from an Excel File into a Power BI solution Using Power Query Dynamic
value.excerpt: Combining multiple files from one folder is already supported built-in through the graphical interface of Power Query when use you Get Data from Folder. However, if you have one Excel file, with multiple sheets with the same structure but different data, you cannot use that option. There is a very little
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gQo5coD9c4M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

This type of connection is only supported by a limited number of data sources, and mainly targets systems with a huge amount of

value.title: Microsoft Power BI: Unleash row level security patterns in Power BI - THR3015
value.excerpt: Security is different from sharing; sharing is about sharing the entire content with others—security is about authorizing different views of the content to others. value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #02: Add single column filter
value.excerpt: By default, a column filter in CALCULATE overwrites the existing filter over the same column.
